The government decided in 2007 to reintroduce conscription, which had been suspended in 1999.[83] No. Suspended indefinitely in 1992 and all members of the armed forces are regular volunteers.[54] No. Conscription at age 18 was suspended in 1999, although all males under age 37 are required to register.[84]

Yes. Legal.[95] Practiced selectively and only rarely.[96] However, military training (known as Citizenship Advancement Training or CAT, formerly known as Citizen's Army Training) is required as a prerequisite for graduation from high school. CAT is considered a subject in high school that lasts up to 2 hours per week.
